Class LocationsDAOImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.furious_furrets.database.LocationsDAOImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LocationDAO
    public class LocationsDAOImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements LocationDAO
    Implementation of the locations DAO including necessary methods for saving, deleting, updating, and adding new locations.

    • Method Detail

      • initTable

        public void initTable()
               throws java.sql.SQLException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Method: initTable()

        An ArrayList of all the locations in the embedded CSV file. Provided as a data structure for the Java objects made from the embedded CSV file. The ArrayList is used to create a SQL table by generating INSERT INTO statements, which is done in the Location class. @Design The method creates a SQL statement, and checks to see if the Location table has been created already. If it has, DROP the table and create a new one, just create a new one if it doesn't exist already. @SQLTable nodeID- Primary Key, node identifier Xcoord- x coordinate of Location node Ycoord- y coordinate of Location node Floor- floor Location is on Building- the building in which the Location is NodeType- denotes the subtype of Location node LongName- name of Location, 255 char limit ShortName- abbreviated name of Location, 128 char limit

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException

      • updateLocation

        public void updateLocation()
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Taking user input for the ID of the location node and the new values of the floor and location type. The Location is then updated in the Locations DB
        Specified by:

      • addLocation

        public void addLocation()
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Taking user input for the ID of the new location node. A new Java Location object is created and the node is added to the SQL table.
        Specified by:
        addLocation in interface LocationDAO
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteLocation

        public void deleteLocation()
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Taking user input for the ID of the location node. The node is removed from the SQL table, and the corresponding Java object is deleted.
        Specified by:
        deleteLocation in interface LocationDAO
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • saveLocation

        public void saveLocation()
        Taking User input for the name of a CSV file. The program first loads all of the contents of the SQL Location table into Java Location objects. Then the CSV file is created from the Java objects.
        Specified by:
        saveLocation in interface LocationDAO
